byline.contributor: Irit Pazner Garshowitz and Myra Noveck contributed reporting.

abstract: Israelis frustrated by lack of public bus service on Sabbath and Jewish holidays have mounted series of protests, leading to larger dialog about relationship between Israeli democracy and Jewish values; issue has been dismissed by some conservatives, but Israeli identity is likely to weigh on Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu as he attempts to stitch together governing coalition.
lead_paragraph: A protest over the lack of public buses on the Sabbath and on holidays has led to a larger discussion about the relationship between Israeli democracy and Jewish character.

headline.main: Push for Buses on Sabbath Sets Off Debate in Israel
headline.print_headline: Push for Buses on Sabbath Sets Off Debate in Israel

snippet: A protest over the lack of public buses on the Sabbath and on holidays has led to a larger discussion about the relationship between Israeli democracy and Jewish character.
